modules.description: This module implements numerical algorithms for finding minima of functions in one dimension. It provides two methods: `brent` for robust and efficient minimization using Brent's method, and `golden_search` for bracketed minimization using the golden section search. These functions operate on floating-point numbers and are suitable for optimizing smooth, univariate functions in scientific computing or parameter tuning scenarios.

This module implements numerical methods for finding maximum points of univariate functions within specified intervals. It provides two algorithms: Brent's method and the golden section search, both returning the location and value of the maximum. These functions are useful in optimization problems where analytical solutions are unavailable, such as tuning parameters in machine learning models or optimizing engineering designs.
